title: Spice Rubbed Pork Chops
instructions: Make the spice rub by combining all the ingredients cited and setting aside.  The spice rub may be stored in a tightly sealed jar in the refrigerator for several months.

Lightly coat the pork chops with olive oil, then measure out 6 tablespoons of the spice rub mixture and massage it into the chops.  Place them on a plate, cover them with plastic wrap, and refrigerate them for at least 1 hour.

Prepare the BBQ grill and when the charcoal is ready, oil the grill and place the meat on the grill directly over the charcoals.  Cook the pork chops on each side until the exterior is golden brown and the inside of thickest part of the pork chop registers at least 145º F. on a meat thermometer.  (This should be about 5 to 6 minutes per side.)
Source:  Zucchini Salad adds Zing to Pork Chops by Annette Gooch, Food Section of the San Antonio Express News, .
